channel.title: C++ Irc Bot
channel.description:
Yes, it sucks, but The Soul told me to post it.
Also, I'm fairly new to C++ programming, so any tips/advice would be great.
4 source files, so download [u][b][url=http://www.mediafire.com/?0yymwzlddfy]here[/url][/b][/u]
Pic: [img]http://img153.imageshack.us/img153/7016/ircbot.png[/img]

item.title: C++ Irc Bot
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

Cut out all the spam and flame, will you all? Thread cleaned.

Read full topic

item.title: C++ Irc Bot
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:8, topic:340593”][quote author=abraham2119 link=topic=436961.msg3218781#msg3218781 date=1274989836]
peehpee, he asked for tips/advice, i gave them to him by pointing out the flaws in his ‘bot’
[/quote]Yea but he didn’t ask to be flamed. The way you pointed out his flaws will likely result in him ignoring everything you say in the future and getting someone with enough self-control to be civil about something so simple.[/quote]
Look, learn when to be grateful for the help you’re offered. Yeah, he was a bit blunt. But toughen up princess – if you’re sensitive enough to get upset by a text-based response to something you say then how are you going to make it in the real world?

There was absolutely nothing wrong with what he said – he pointed out numerous flaws, he pointed out why they were flaws, and he mentioned how to rectify at least a few of them.

Read full topic

item.title: C++ Irc Bot
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

edit: yes, the code is horrendous... although you need to take into account that this is moparscape and just about everyone here has the learning capacity of a mentally ill child. this isn't moparisthebest where everyone has had years of experience and will be demoralized for the slightest mistakes in their code. just because you can pick every small mistake and turn it into a full blown argument doesn't mean you should.

Thinking like this is the exact reason why moparisthebest.com is shit. You shouldn’t be cutting someone slack when they are blatantly wrong. Take the criticism and grow stronger or don’t post at all.

Read full topic

item.title: C++ Irc Bot
item.dc:creator: @PeeHPee PeeHPee
item.description:
@PeeHPee wrote:

[quote=“abraham2119, post:5, topic:340593”]This is the most horrendous thing I’ve ever fucking seen.

system("title C++ Irc Bot by Fellixombc");

I laughed so hard at this, you are such an idiot

while (size == 0) { ioctlsocket(client, FIONREAD, &size); } Great job on blowing CPU usage to the sky.

if (length == 0) { cout << "Disconnected from Server." << endl; Disconnect(); } Why the hell do you close the socket in “Bot::Disconnect()” if a return value of ‘0’ means the connection has already been closed? Also, funny how you don’t even check for a return value of “SOCKET_ERROR”.

Bot *irc = new Bot("Bot_Bob", "#botbob");

Great memory leak. You never free that allocated block of memory, not even during application clean-up.

Learn to use local variables, not everything has to be a class member.
Use hpp files as C++ headers, not h.[/quote][quote=“fellixombc, post:1, topic:340593”]Also, I’m fairly new to C++ programming, so any tips/advice would be great.[/quote]

shut up

edit: yes, the code is horrendous… although you need to take into account that this is moparscape and just about everyone here has the learning capacity of a mentally ill child. this isn’t moparisthebest where everyone has had years of experience and will be demoralized for the slightest mistakes in their code. just because you can pick every small mistake and turn it into a full blown argument doesn’t mean you should.

edit2: fuck i feel like a faggot

Read full topic

item.title: C++ Irc Bot
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

This is the most horrendous thing I’ve ever fucking seen.

system("title C++ Irc Bot by Fellixombc");

I laughed so hard at this, you are such an idiot

while (size == 0) { ioctlsocket(client, FIONREAD, &size); } Great job on blowing CPU usage to the sky.

if (length == 0) { cout << "Disconnected from Server." << endl; Disconnect(); } Why the hell do you close the socket in “Bot::Disconnect()” if a return value of ‘0’ means the connection has already been closed? Also, funny how you don’t even check for a return value of “SOCKET_ERROR”.

Bot *irc = new Bot("Bot_Bob", "#botbob");

Great memory leak. You never free that allocated block of memory, not even during application clean-up.

Learn to use local variables, not everything has to be a class member.
Use hpp files as C++ headers, not h.

Read full topic
